column5: MARC Content Standard (if applicable for mapping differences)
column10: Conversion Notes

column3: # = Empty (in some MARC serializations represented as '#')
column6: :w1 == bf:Work instance, :in1 == bf:Instance instance, :it1 == bf:Item instance. # == # or Empty.

bf:Work URI path, i.e. <http://ld4l.org/resources/cornell/1234567> Presuming for the sake of this conversion spec that the following structure: related bf:Instance URIs would be <http://ld4l.org/resources/cornell/1234567/instance1> (last number to change for instance identifiers or system settings), related bf:Item URIs would be <http://ld4l.org/resources/cornell/1234567/instance1/item1> (same note about item identifiers / system settings as with instances).
column10: Control number i.e. record identifier within the originating system. Pairs with the 003, which gives the system originating the control number.
Ignore.
Ignore, unless we don't want to convert deleted records.

column6:
bf:Work subclass (:w1 a) applied to resource, following this mapping:
a = bf:Text
c = bf:NotatedMusic
d = bf:NotatedMusic, create related bf:Instance and type bf:Manuscript
e = bf:Cartography
f = bf:Cartography, create related bf:Instance and type bf:Manuscript
g = Projected medium?
i = bf:Audio
j = bf:Audio
k = bf:StillImage
m = schema:SoftwareApplication
o = Kit?
p = bf:MixedMaterials
r = bf:Object
t = bf:Text, create related bf:Instance and type bf:Manuscript
column9:
Letter code, one of the following:
a - Language material
c - Notated music
d - Manuscript notated music
e - Cartographic material
f - Manuscript cartographic material
g - Projected medium
i - Nonmusical sound recording
j - Musical sound recording
k - Two-dimensional nonprojectable graphic
m - Computer file
o - Kit
p - Mixed materials
r - Three-dimensional artifact or naturally occurring object
t - Manuscript language material

column6:
Additional type or assertion applied to bf:Work resource. Not all values are mapped.
a = :w1 bf:issuance ld4l:MonographicPart
b = :w1 bf:issuance ld4l:SerialPart
c = :w1 a bf:Collection
d = do not map.
i = :w1 bf:issuance ld4l:IntegratingResource
m  = :w1 bf:issuance ld4l:Monograph
s = :w1 bf:issuance ld4l:Serial
column9:
Letter code, one of the following:
a - Monographic component part
b - Serial component part
c - Collection
d - Subunit
i - Integrating resource
m - Monograph/Item
s - Serial
column10: This is actively under modeling consideration/changes. Preferably, the serial / monograph / part-whole aspects covered here will be translated to the RDF based off of other notes in the MARC bibliographic record that also give the related Work or Instance.

column6:
Additional type applied to bf:Instance resource related to bf:Work resource.
# = do not map.
a = bf:Instance is also instance of subclass bf:Archival.
column9:
Letter or character code, one of the following:
# - No specified type
a - Archival
column10: The Archival subclass of Instance is still under discussion.

column9:
Character code, one of the following:
# - MARC-8
a - UCS/Unicode
column10: Use this to make the convertor aware of encoding ahead. Convert all data in RDF to Unicode - check with Convertor team.
Largely ignore, unless we are dealing with non-US or non-MARC21 MARC.
Largely ignore, unless we are dealing with non-US or non-MARC21 MARC.
Ignore?
Ignore for conversion, as this covers completeness or not of record. Will probably come back up later on.
Ignore for conversion, as this covers the content standard in use. Will probably come back up later on.
Ignore for now. Same issue as with part / serials / etc. code above.

column2: Various record / MARC specifications for validity of record encoding.
column10: This may come back up if we run into validity issues with the MARC being converted, but ignore for now.

column6: :w1 URI path indicating the institution, i.e. <http://ld4l.org/resources/[cornell for NIC]/1234567>. See related notes on 001.
column10: Values taken from the databases here: http://www.loc.gov/marc/organizations/ Uncertain if these MARC Organization codes are available anywhere as LOD. This field is not always present, so we may need to derive the institution from other fields or convertor data sources.

column2: Date and Time of Latest Transaction
column10: Sixteen characters that indicate the date and time of the latest record transaction and serve as a version identifier for the record.

column6: Mapping being worked on (008 is a bit of an untangle).

column2: Library of Congress Control Number: LC control number (NR)
column6: :w1 owl:sameAs <generate lccn URI based off identifier>
column7: URI generation from just the path/identifier portion. Prepend 'http://lccn.loc.gov/' to the identifier value.
column10: This will probably require further normalization to make the URIs valid (removing spaces, link verifcation, etc.).
